title: Haleakalā National Park: Archive
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases     Archive                Archive           Subscribe  | What is RSS     July 12, 2016  Park’s Next Commercial-Free Day Set for July 18  The next commercial-free day at Haleakalā National Park will occur on Monday, July 18, 2016 (Lolopua, one of the two days commonly known as zenith noon).   July 08, 2016  Hōlua Backcountry Area Closed for Ant Control  The Hōlua backcountry area of Haleakalā National Park will close from the evening of Thursday, July 14th through late afternoon on July 15th so park biologists can control non-native Argentine ants.   July 06, 2016  Haleakalā National Park Extends Public Comment Period For Nu'u Environmental Assessment  The National Park Service (NPS) is extending the comment period for the  Environmental Assessment for the Management and Removal of Feral Animals in the Upper Elevations of Nu‘u, Maui.   June 17, 2016  Park’s Next Commercial-Free Day Set for June 21  The next commercial-free day at Haleakalā National Park will occur on Tuesday, June 21, 2016 (Summer Solstice).   June 14, 2016  Haleakalā National Park Announces Public Comment Period For Nu`u Area Environmental Assessment  The National Park Service (NPS) announces the availability of an Environmental Assessment for the Management and Removal of Feral Animals in the Upper Elevations of Nu‘u, Maui, for review and comment.   June 09, 2016  Haleakalā National Park Community Meeting to Discuss Backcountry Facilities and Operations  The public is invited to attend a community meeting hosted by Haleakalā National Park on Wednesday, June 15, 2016, at the Pukalani Community Center.   May 16, 2016  2016 Park Entrance Fees to Increase on June 1  Beginning on June 1, 2016, Haleakalā National Park daily entrance fees will be raised to meet national standards for parks with similar visitor amenities.   May 13, 2016  Call for Cultural Practitioners at Haleakalā National Park  Haleakalā National Park seeks cultural practitioners from local communities for Hana No`eau, a series of cultural demonstrations that will be offered in the park’s Kīpahulu and Summit Districts.   April 26, 2016  Tourism to Haleakalā National Park Creates Over $76 Million and 905 Jobs in Local Economy  A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 1,216,772 visitors to Haleakalā National Park in 2015 spent over $76 million in communities near the park.   April 23, 2016  Uncle Rex Honored With Happy 100th Birthday Letter from Tulsi Gabbard  On April 23, Uncle Rex Ornellas received a Happy 100th Birthday letter sent from U. S. Congressional Representative Tulsi Gabbard.   April 21, 2016  Park Offers Free Junior Ranger Day Special Events on April 23  Entrance fees continue to be waived during National Park Week, April 16-24.   April 14, 2016  Park Seeks Input Regarding Sunrise Operations  Haleakalā National Park will hold two public meetings regarding summit sunrise operations.   April 12, 2016  Free Park Admission and Special Events during National Park Week, April 16-24  During the 1930’s Great Depression, President Roosevelt formed the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) in order to employ young men.   April 07, 2016  Haleakalā Guided Vehicle Tour Concession Proposals Sought  The National Park Service has issued a prospectus soliciting proposals in response to a business opportunity to operate guided vehicle tours in Haleakalā National Park.   March 04, 2016  Park’s Next Commercial-Free Day Set for Wednesday, March 9  The next commercial-free day at Haleakalā National Park will occur on Wednesday, March 9, 2016 (Nana, Muku Moon).   February 29, 2016  225 Maui Students Plant 317 Threatened Silverswords  During February, a total of 225 students in the fourth through eighth grades from the Montessori School, Seabury Hall, Kamehameha Schools, and Kalama Intermediate School planted 317 federally threatened `āhinahina (silverswords) at the summit of Haleakalā as part of the Centennial celebrations of both Haleakalā National Park and the National Park Service.   February 22, 2016  Haleakalā Visitor Center to Close for Repairs  The Haleakalā Visitor Center, located at 9741 feet of elevation on the crater rim, will close for door repairs on February 24.   February 17, 2016  Headquarters Visitor Center to Re-open on Wednesday, February 24  The Headquarters Visitor Center, located at 7000 feet of elevation, will re-open on Wednesday, February 24.   February 16, 2016  Haleakalā National Park Community Meeting in Kīpahulu to Discuss Emergency Prepardness  The public is invited to attend a community meeting hosted by Haleakalā National Park on Wednesday, February 17, 2016, at the park’s Kīpahulu Visitor Center.   January 28, 2016  Haleakalā National Park announces habitat restoration at Nu‘u  Funding provided through the NPS Centennial Challenge Program.   December 17, 2015  Park’s Next Commercial-Free Day Set for December 22  The next commercial-free day at Haleakalā National Park will occur on Tuesday, December 22, 2015 (Ka’elo, Huna Moon).   December 08, 2015  Temporary Water Unavailability in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park  Over the next two weeks, water pumps will be replaced in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā NP.   December 02, 2015  Maui Glass Blower Creates Ornaments for 2015 National Tree Lighting  Noor Dphrepaulezz to Create Hawai'i’s Ornaments for Holiday Display at President’s Park in Washington, D.C. ORNAMENTS FROM ALL 56 U.S. STATES, TERRITORIES, AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA INSPIRE PEOPLE TO FIND THEIR PARK DURING THE HOLIDAYS   August 25, 2015  Meet the Young Author of Park’s New Junior Ranger Book  On Sunday, August 30, 2015, from 11am to 2pm, the park will unveil a new Junior Ranger Activity Book through a “Meet the Authors” event with Eliot Carter, the book’s 6-year-old author and primary field tester, and his parents.   August 24, 2015  Nēnē Awareness Day Contest Begins on August 25  The National Park Service turns 99 years old on August 25. To celebrate, Haleakalā NP will waive park entrance fees for the day and kick off the park’s annual Nēnē Awareness Day contest for middle schoolers.   August 14, 2015  Park Summit Road To Close During Wide Load Transport August 19-20  Crater Road (Rt. 378) and Haleakalā National Park’s summit road will close to visitor traffic while a slow moving convoy transports extremely wide loads to the Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope near the volcano’s summit.   July 24, 2015  Park Summit Road to Close During Wide Load Transport July 2015  Crater Road (Rt. 378) and Haleakalā National Park’s summit road will close to visitor traffic while a slow moving convoy transports extremely wide loads to the Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope near the volcano’s summit.   July 22, 2015  Ti Leaf Lei Making and Traditional Games in Kīpahulu  On Sunday, July 26, 2015, from 1:00 to 3:00 p.m., Pi‘ilani Lua will demonstrate Ti leaf lei making and traditional Hawaiian games in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park.   July 16, 2015  Feather Flower Making This Friday at Haleakalā’s Summit  On Friday July 17, 2015, Patti Gomez will demonstrate feather flower making in the Summit District of Haleakalā National Park.   July 14, 2015  Park’s First Commercial-Free Day Set for July 18  The first commercial-free day at Haleakalā National Park will occur on Saturday, July 18, 2015.   July 09, 2015  Hōlua Area Closed for Ant Control  The Hōlua backcountry area of Haleakalā National Park will close from the evening of July 16 through late afternoon on July 17 so park biologists can control non-native Argentine ants.   July 02, 2015  Girls Court Explores Haleakalā Wilderness  On June 16-18, 2015, eight participants and four staff members from the Hawai‛i Girls Court visited Haleakalā National Park, spending three days and two nights in the Haleakalā crater.   June 18, 2015  Park Summit Road To Close During Wide Load Transport  Crater Road (Rt. 378) and Haleakalā National Park’s summit road will close to visitor traffic while a slow moving convoy transports extremely wide loads to the Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope near the volcano’s summit.   June 04, 2015  Kīpahulu `Ohana Featured in Cultural Demonstration Series  On Monday, June 8, the Kīpahulu `Ohana will demonstrate poi pounding in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park between 1pm and 3pm.   May 28, 2015  Cultural Demonstration Series Begins  On Monday, June 1, cultural practitioner Bolly Helekahi will launch the 2015 Hana No`eau cultural demonstration series, in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park.   May 20, 2015  New Park Entrance Fees Approved  Increased entrance fees to Haleakalā National Park have been approved by the National Park Service. One significant modification to the new fee structure was based on public input.   May 12, 2015  Deadline Approaching for Haleakalā National Park Trail Volunteer Program  The deadline to apply for the park’s Kia`i ala Hele (Trail Guardians) volunteer program is Wednesday, May 20. Families are particularly encouraged to apply.   May 11, 2015  Haleakalā National Park Reminds Public of Public Scoping Meetings For an Environmental Assessment  The National Park Service, in partnership with the Leeward Haleakalā Watershed Restoration Partnership and the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation, proposes to protect and restore either 1,300 or 2,100 acres of habitat for native species in the upper elevations of Nu‘u on the leeward slope of Haleakalā.   April 29, 2015  Park Recruiting for Kia`i Ala Hele Volunteer Program  Haleakalā National Park is recruiting local residents for Kia`i ala Hele (Trail Guardians) to educate backpackers and hikers about the unique natural and cultural resources of Haleakalā.   April 27, 2015  Haleakalā NP Announces Teacher Training Opportunity  Haleakalā National Park is seeking applicants currently working in Maui County Title One K-12 schools for a six week summer professional development opportunity.   April 23, 2015  Deadline to Apply for Summer Cultural Demonstration Series at Haleakalā National Park  The deadline to apply for this summer’s Hana No`eau cultural demonstration series is April 30.   April 23, 2015  Tourism to Haleakalā National Park Creates Over $70 Million and 837 Jobs in Local Economy  A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 1,142,040 visitors to Haleakalā National Park in 2014 spent over $70 million in communities near the park.   April 17, 2015  Haleakalā National Park Announces Public Scoping Period for an Environmental Assessment  The public is invited to participate in a public scoping period and public meetings for proposed conservation work.   April 09, 2015  Free Admission Marks Start of National Park Week  All national parks will waive entrance fees on April 18 and 19, during the beginning of National Park Week.   April 08, 2015  Haleakalā National Park Community Meeting in Kīpahulu to Discuss Improvements to Facilities And The Volunteer Program  The public is invited to attend a community meeting hosted by Haleakalā National Park on Wednesday, April 15, 2015, at Kalena Triangle in Kīpahulu.   March 31, 2015  National Park Week 2015 Encourages Everyone To “Find Your Park”  Haleakalā National Park joins parks, programs and partners across the country to encourage everyone to find their park and share their stories online at www.FindYourPark.com.   March 16, 2015  Headquarters Visitor Center Now Open As Of 8am March 17  The Headquarters Visitor Center of Haleakalā National Park will re-open at 8am today, March 17.   March 04, 2015  Headquarters Visitor Center to stay closed until structural engineer assesses the damage  The Headquarters Visitor Center of Haleakalā NP will remain closed until a structural engineer can assess the damage and determine how and when the building can be reopened.   February 12, 2015  Haleakalā National Park Community Meeting In Hana to Discuss New Planning Document  The public is invited to attend a community meeting hosted by Haleakalā National Park on Wednesday, February 18, 2015, in the Old Hana School Cafeteria. The meeting is scheduled from 5:00pm to 6:30pm.   February 11, 2015  Free Entry to Haleakalā National Park during President’s Day Weekend  On President’s Day holiday weekend, February 14-16, 2015, Haleakalā National Park will waive entrance fees for all park visitors.   February 10, 2015  Call for Guided Astronomy and Hiking Tour Commercial Use Authorizations  Beginning Tuesday February 10, 2015, Haleakalā National Park will accept applications for guided astronomy and hiking tour Commercial Use Authorizations, which will be valid for up to two years.   January 22, 2015  DEADLINE REMINDER Haleakalā National Park College Internship Program Application Deadline: February 06, 2015  The application deadline for Haleakalā National Park’s ‘Imi i ka Lama Collegiate Internship Program is Friday, February 6, 2015.   January 15, 2015  Park Foundation Document Comment Period Opens  Haleakalā NP is developing a “Foundation Document” to describe a shared understanding of what is most important about the park.   January 13, 2015  Hosmer Grove Re-opens  The nesting nēnē family that prompted closure of Hosmer Grove in Haleakalā National Park lost its young gosling.   January 09, 2015  Hosmer Grove Closed Due to Nesting Nēnē  Hosmer Grove campground and trail will be closed until further notice to protect a family of nēnē that is nesting in the popular campground.   December 29, 2014  Female Nēnē Killed by Car on Park Road  On December 26th at 7:15 am a female nēnē was killed by a car on the downhill side of the park road near Headquarters Visitor Center.   December 08, 2014  Slow Down. Save a Nēnē.  Nēnē breeding season has arrived, which means the endangered birds are more active along Crater Road in Haleakalā National Park.   December 05, 2014  Invasive Pine Control Project to Begin Next Week at Haleakalā National Park  Between December 8 and 11, 2014, Haleakalā National Park will use contracted helicopters to eliminate 3000 invasive pine trees in the park.   December 04, 2014  Haleakalā NP Middle School Internship Application Deadline Is Fast Approaching  The application deadline for the Kupukupu ‘Āina middle school internship program is Wednesday, January 7, 2015.   November 25, 2014  Haleakalā National Park Now Accepting Applications For College Internship Program  Applications are now being accepted for the 2015 ‘Imi i ka Lama Collegiate Internship Program at Haleakalā National Park.   October 14, 2014  Haleakalā National Park Proposes Revision of Entrance Fee Structure  Haleakalā National Park will hold two public meetings to outline proposed fee increases scheduled to begin in 2015.   September 19, 2014  Park Announces Commercial-Free Days for 2015  As part of the new Commercial Service Plan, five commercial-free days have been determined for Haleakalā National Park, beginning in July 2015.   August 30, 2014  Haleakalā NP marks 50th Anniversary of Wilderness Act  September 3, 2014 marks the 50th Anniversary of the Wilderness Act.   August 27, 2014  Summit and Kīpahulu Districts Offer Cultural Demos this Weekend  On Saturday, August 30, the cultural demonstration series Hana No`eau concludes with events in both districts of Haleakalā National Park.   August 21, 2014  Haleakalā National Park Offers Free Admission on August 25  Haleakalā National Park will celebrate the 98th birthday of the National Park Service by waiving its normal entrance fee of $10 on Monday, August 25.   August 21, 2014  Park Seeks Student Artists for Nēnē Awareness Day Logo Contest  In celebration of Nēnē Awareness Day (September 26) Haleakalā National Park is seeking student artists in grades 6, 7, and 8 for a Nēnē Awareness Day Logo Contest.   August 19, 2014  Paragliders Apprehended in Haleakalā National Park  On Tuesday, August 19, two males were apprehended in Haleakalā NP for illegal paragliding activities in the crater.   August 18, 2014  Haleakalā National Park Community Meeting In Kīpahulu District  The public is invited to attend a community meeting hosted by Haleakalā National Park on Wednesday, August 20, 2014, at the Kīpahulu Visitor Center.   August 11, 2014  Feather Flower Making Featured This Sunday In Kīpahulu  On Sunday, August 17, Patricia Gomez will demonstrate feather flower making in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park. The activity is part of Hana No`eau, the park’s cultural demonstration series which features local residents.   August 09, 2014  Haleakala To Reopen Saturday Afternoon  The Summit and Kīpahulu Districts of Haleakalā National Park will reopen by Saturday afternoon after park crews assess road, campground, and building conditions, and clean up downed trees and rock slides caused by the storm.   August 06, 2014  Haleakalā NP to Close at Noon Thursday Afternoon in Preparation for Tropical Storm Iselle  To protect visitor safety, the Summit and Kīpahulu Districts of Haleakalā NP will close at noon Thursday afternoon in anticipation of heavy winds and rain.   August 04, 2014  `Ohe`o Stream Closed During Servicing Of Monitoring Equipment  The 'Ohe'o stream, located along the Pīpīwai Trail, will be closed for several days starting Tuesday while the stream monitoring equipment is serviced.   July 28, 2014  Deadline Approaching to Register for August Teacher Workshops  Haleakalā National Park is offering two free workshops for teachers and informal educators this August.   July 28, 2014  Hawaiian Flag Day Commemorated at 5 Hawai`i National Parks  Haleakalā National Park and four national parks on Hawai‘i Island will simultaneously commemorate the first national holiday in Hawai‘i, Lā Hae Hawai‘i (Hawaiian Flag Day) on Thursday, July 31.   July 23, 2014  No Potable Water in Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā Due to Water Main Leak  Due to a leak in the main waterline in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park there is no potable water in Kīpahulu for the foreseeable future.   July 21, 2014  Ti leaf lei making featured this Saturday in Kīpahulu  On Saturday, July 26, cultural practitioner Pi`ilani Lua will teach ti leaf lei making in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park.   July 18, 2014  Tourism to Haleakalā National Park Creates Over $47 Million and 536 Jobs in Local Economy  A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 785,300 visitors to Haleakalā National Park in 2013 spent over $47 million in communities near the park. That spending supported 536 jobs in the local area.   July 07, 2014  Hula and Feather Flower Making Featured This Saturday in Kīpahulu  On Saturday, July 12, Judy Kinser will teach hula and Patricia Gomez will demonstrate feather flower making in the Kīpahulu District of Haleakalā National Park.   July 03, 2014  Local Residents Become Haleakalā Trail Guardians  Fourteen local residents recently completed training to become Kia`i Ala Hele (Trail Guardians). These volunteers will hike popular trails in the Summit District to help visitors discover Haleakalā.   May 15, 2014  Haleakalā Silversword a Highlight of the Goyang Korea Flower Show  From April 24 to May 11, 2014, several Haleakalā `ahinahina (silversword) were featured in a combined Haleakala National Park - Maui County booth at the 18th Goyang Korea Flower Show.   April 23, 2014  Earth Day Teacher Workshop Held at Haleakalā National Park  The Hawai`i Department of Education Maui District and Haleakalā National Park recently partnered to offer a Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) workshop for Maui County STEM teachers.   April 17, 2014  Go Wild for Haleakalā National Park!  Celebrate National Park Week with Free Admission and Special Events   April 11, 2014  Haleakalā National Park 2014 Call for Cultural Practitioners  Haleakalā National Park 2014 Call for Cultural Practitioners DEADLINE EXTENSION and new location added!   April 09, 2014  Oheo stream remains closed due to high water and damaged stream monitoring equipment  The ʻOheʻo stream, located along the Pīpīwai Trail, remains closed due to high water and damaged stream monitoring equipment.   March 07, 2014  Haleakala National Park chosen by Kaahumanu Macys  Beginning March 7, 2014, Maui shoppers at Macy’s in the the Ka`ahumanu Shopping Center in Kahului will be given the option at check-out to donate to $1 or more to Haleakalā National Park.   March 06, 2014  Haleakala National Park seeks trail steward volunteers  Do you enjoy hiking, spectacular views, and educating people? Haleakalā National Park is seeking fit and enthusiastic Maui residents to participate in the Kia`i Ala Hele trail stewards program beginning in June 2014.   March 05, 2014  Call for Cultural Practitioners at Haleakala National Park  Haleakalā National Park seeks cultural practitioners for a series of cultural demonstrations that will be offered in the Kīpahulu District of the park beginning in mid-June 2014.   March 03, 2014  Tourism to Haleakala National Park Creates Over 64 Million Dollars and 736 Jobs in Local Economy  Tourism to Haleakalā National Park Creates Over $64 Million and 736 Jobs in Local Economy   December 17, 2013  Haleakala National Park Seeks Applicants For 2014 Imi I Ka Lama Summer Internship Program For Hawaiis College Students  HALEAKALĀ NATIONAL PARK SEEKS APPLICANTS FOR 2014 ‘IMI I KA LAMA SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM FOR HAWAI‘I’S COLLEGE STUDENTS   December 02, 2013  New Bilingual Brochure First in National Park System  Haleakalā Cultural Brochure   November 21, 2013  Haleakala National Park Announces Recruitment For Free Middle School Intern Program  Haleakalā National Park Announces Recruitment For Free Middle School Intern Program   November 20, 2013  Two Female Nene Killed by Speeding Motorists  Two Female Nēnē Killed by Speeding Motorist.   September 06, 2013  Brief Delays For Drivers in The Kipahulu Section of Haleakala National Park  Brief Delays For Drivers in The Kipahulu Section of Haleakala National Park   July 26, 2013  Headquarters Visitor Center Parking Lot Closed for Accessibility Improvements  Headquarters Visitor Center parking lot improvements.   July 19, 2013  Upper Skyline Trail Access Closed During Construction  Upper Skyline Trail Access Closed During Red Hill Construction July 18-25   July 08, 2013  Haleakala Red Hill Parking Lot to Fully Close During Construction  Haleakalā Red Hill Parking Lot to Fully Close During Construction   June 21, 2013  Hosmer Grove Campground Parking Lot Repairs Begin  Hosmer Grove Campground parking lot improvements begin Tuesday, June 25, 2013 and will take approximately one month to complete.   June 13, 2013  Halemauu Trailhead Parking Lot Closing for Accessability Improvements  Halemauu Trailhead Parking Lot Closing for Accessability Improvements   May 17, 2013  HALEAKALA NATIONAL PARK PARKING LOT IMPROVEMENTS CONTINUE  HALEAKALĀ NATIONAL PARK PARKING LOT IMPROVEMENTS CONTINUE   February 28, 2013  Haleakala National Park Tourism Creates Millions in Local Economic Benefit  Part of $30 billion impact that supports 252,000 jobs nationwide   January 15, 2013  Global Warming May Have Severe Consequences for Rare Haleakala Silverswords  Recent research suggest global warming may have severe consequences for rare Haleakalā silverswords.   January 14, 2013  Natalie Gates Appointed as Superintendent  Natalie Gates Appointed as Superintendent of Haleakala National Park   December 05, 2012  2013 High School Internship Recruitment  Haleakala National Park is recruiting for the 2013 High School Internship Program through March 15, 2013.   December 05, 2012  2013 Middle School Internship Recruitment  Haleakala National Park is recruiting middle school interns through Jan. 31, 2013.   June 28, 2012  Draft Commercial Services Plan and Environmental Assessment released  Draft CSP released and open for public comment   September 16, 2011  Fee Free Day on 9-24-11  Haleakala NP offers Fee Free Day on September 24, 2011.   September 14, 2011  Evening Program on 9-17-11  Join park staff for an evening of star gazing and star lore on Saturday, 9/17.   September 05, 2011  Holua Campground Closure  Holua Campground will be closed for ant control on the nights of Sept. 8 and Sept. 19.   June 15, 2011  Fee Free Day on June 21, 2011  Fee Free Day on June 21, 2011   June 02, 2011  Hosmer Grove Campground Closed June 6-8  Hosmer Grove Campground and parking lot will be closed for hazardous tree removal on June 6-8.   June 02, 2011  Park Confirms Fatal Mishap in Kipahulu  Park confirms fatal mishap in Kipahulu   June 02, 2011  Kilo hoku -Stargazing- Program on June 4  Join park staff for some stargazing and star lore.   April 29, 2011  Ongoing and Planned Park Projects in Kipahulu That May Cause Noise  Ongoing and Planned Park Projects in Kipahulu That May Cause Noise   April 13, 2011  Air Tour Management Plan Alternatives  Three community meetings will be held to gather comments on the Air Tour Management Plan Alternatives.   April 13, 2011  National Junior Ranger Day 2011  Celebrate National Junior Ranger Day at Haleakala National Park on April 23.   January 12, 2011  Severe Weather Forces Park Closures  Severe Weather Forces Park Closures   December 06, 2010  2011 TriPark Pass Available  Hawai`i's TriPark Pass is now available and provides year-long access to the 3 Hawai`i National Parks.   November 04, 2010  Help Save Hawaiian Seabirds  If you find a grounded seabird, please call 1-877-428-6911 (Haleakala National Park Dispatch).   March 01, 2010  Get a Job at Haleakala National Park  Participate in Haleakala National Park's job fair   January 14, 2010  Hike Haleakala's Trails as a Volunteer  Haleakala National Park is seeking volunteers to patrol trails.   November 04, 2009  Haleakala Entrance Fees Waived on Veterans Day  Haleakala Entrance Fees Waived on Veteran’s Day   October 27, 2009  Haleakala is Now Tweeting Press Releases on Twitter  Haleakala to tweet press releases.   September 15, 2009  Talk Story Over a Cup of Coffee with Haleakala Rangers September 21-27  Come talk story with Haleakala Park rangers over coffee about the history and culture of the park service, park programs and policies, the future of National Parks, and ways that the public can get involved in the management of their park.   September 15, 2009  Campground at Kipahulu to Reopen  Campground at Kipahulu reopens.   August 20, 2009  Haleakala to host Star Program on August 22  Join us at Hosmer Grove for kilo hökü (star watching)   August 11, 2009  Haleakala National Park Continues With Precautionary Measures as Tropical Depression Felicia Passes Over  Haleakala National Park continues with precautionary measures as Tropical Depression Felicia passes over.   June 08, 2009  Kipahulu Campground Closed due to Construction  No abstract supplied.   April 25, 2008  First centennial project coming to Haleakala National Park  No abstract supplied.   April 25, 2008  $2.3 million partnership effort announced at Haleakala  No abstract supplied.   March 24, 2008  Downhill Bicycle Tour Moratorium Continues at Haleakala National Park  No abstract supplied.   October 04, 2007  Haleakala National Park Issues Safety Stand-Down to Commercially guided Bike Tours  A Safety Stand-Down of commercially guided downhill bicycle tours in Haleakalā National Park was ordered today, effective October 10, 2007,  said National Park Superintendent Marilyn H. Parris.  The Safety Stand Down affects the seven commercial companies that hold permits, also known as commercial use authorizations (CUA), to operate within the park.  These authorizations will be terminated also effective October 10, 2007.   June 28, 2007  Leleiwi Overlook In Haleakala National Park Closed due to Visitor Fatality.  No abstract supplied.   April 11, 2007  Fee Increase Proposed by Haleakala  No abstract supplied.   December 29, 2006  Fireworks & Alcohol Restrictions  New Years Weekend Fireworks and Alcohol Restrictions in the Park   December 18, 2006  Visitor Succumbs to Fatal Heart Attack Along High Elevation Trail  Hiker pronounced dead after heart attack on Sliding Sands Trail.   December 15, 2006  Kipahulu Area Reopened to Public  Temporary bridge at Paihi allows park to reopen the Kipahulu Area.   November 01, 2006  Remains of a Rainbow Photography Exhibit  Photographic Portraits of Rare Plants and Animals on Display at Haleakala National Park.   October 26, 2006  Kipahulu Area Closed  Kipahulu area of Haleakala National Park Closed due to Visitor Safety Concerns.   October 18, 2006  Biologists Ask for Public's Help as Endangered Seabirds Leave Nests  As these endangered seabirds fledge and leave their nests, biologists ask for public attention to recover lost, confused or injured young birds.   September 25, 2006  National Public Lands Day  Haleakala National Park celebrates National Public Lands Day with free entrance to the park on Saturday September 30, 2006.   August 09, 2006  Seeking Public Input for Managing Commercial Services  Haleakala National Park is setting into motion a process to manage commercial services in the park. The public is invited and encouraged to be a part of this process.
